The security of the American people should be more important than partisan politics and as a former national security specialist at the U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) and a current member of the House Armed Services Committee Democrats, I can tell you the last place partisan politics belongs is in national security.  Today I introduced a bill in response to the president's recent national directive on the National Security Council (NSC) structure. My bill will protect and ensure the NSC is receiving counsel from national experts without the dangerous influence of partisan politics. #FL07

February is Black History Month and I am proud to pay tribute to the countless contributions African Americans have made to this country and to the world. Let’s use this moment to recognize the progress we have made in many areas, but also to acknowledge the work that remains undone – and the long journey ahead of us until we truly achieve equality and justice for all.   I will do my part in Congress to promote principles like diversity, equality, compassion, and opportunity for all. And I will stand up to bigotry, racism, xenophobia, and sexism whenever I see it. This is not the time for silence; it is the time for action. If we are going to live up to our country’s promise, we must never stop working until every American has access to a good education, safe communities, and equal opportunities to achieve the American dream.    Let’s be proud of our history, optimistic about the future, and determined to strengthen our great country. What will you do to help move our nation forward? #FL07

Today is Safer Internet Day – a day that encourages internet users of all ages and interests to proactively make the internet a safer and more welcoming place for everyone in the U.S. and across the globe.    We use the internet for so many of our daily activities and sometimes we take for granted the sensitive information that we’re putting out on the web. It’s important that we stay engaged and focus on better ways of making the internet safer for ourselves, for our children and for future generations. Don’t stay quiet; make sure to report harmful content you find online.    It is especially important today as we face cyber threats domestically and from abroad. So let’s be vigilant and aware of our internet usage and the information we share online. #FL07   Find internet safety and security tips:

I am disappointed the President did not use this opportunity to offer a concrete plan to unify the country and Congress to grow the middle class, strengthen education, make health care more accessible and affordable, and safeguard our nation.     However, I am optimistic there are opportunities for the President and Congress to work together.  I am especially pleased to hear that the President wants to make childcare accessible and affordable, ensure parents obtain family leave, invest in women’s health, and rebuild our infrastructure.   Earlier this month, some of my congressional colleagues and I requested a meeting with the President to discuss ways to improve our nation’s aging infrastructure.  If the President is serious about this issue, he will find a willing partner in me and many of my fellow Members of Congress.   I continue to be concerned about the President’s undisciplined approach to national security, which undermines rather than enhances our safety.  I also did not see a realistic plan to replace the Affordable Care Act—only a politically-motivated effort to eliminate health care coverage for millions of Americans and send our health care system into chaos.  Right now, the American public is calling for unity, cooperation, and results.  I stand ready and willing to work with the White House and both parties in Congress to put good public policy above partisan politics on issues where we can find common ground.  I encourage the President to do the same. #FL07

I just voted against the GOP tax bill. Earlier this year, I introduced a balanced budget amendment to address the excessive federal debt, which is a threat to our economic stability, our national security, and the Social Security and Medicare benefits that our seniors have earned through a lifetime of hard work.
